page.title: 06A Farmer's Day
page.content: Bleep,Bleep,Bleep goes the alarm clock reading{7.00am}to wake up the farmer for winter labour on his 217 acre farm{near Old Dailly.}After his breakfast of hot porridge he starts off on his morning round to feed his animals. He then checks the farm for any damage caused by the weather or by his own animals. Once again he tramps over the hills but this time back to his wife waiting with some traditional hot farmhouse broth cooked after his tiring but enjoyable morning. He sets off once more after his feed to finish his repairs and weather permitting,maybe plough a field or tackle the job of spreading dung. After all this he can relax and enjoy a peaceful car drive in {Girvan,}the nearest town,to buy food for his evening meal.
